title: 820-3332 no green light
message: 820-3332 no green light, im a little confused , i have ppbus g3 and pp3v42, at u6900 pin 1 (sm_bc_acok) i have 3.4v pin 5 (adaptor_sense) i have 5.15v, at pin 4 (sys_onewire) i have 3.4V but no green light ?, forgot to say no signs of any liquid damage anyway

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: Voltage on PPBUS? Tried known good DC in board? Trackpad, keyboard, and all the internals unplugged?

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: 5V at adapter sense is a problem. Usually a bad magsafe board or crap under J6900.

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: ok thats wierd, the magsafe shows a green light on another board , but changed i anyway for a new one and guess what i have 2.9v at adaptor sense, but still no green light ,the other voltages are as before

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: Please answer every question! Voltage at PPBUS_G3H?

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: Also these need to show an orange light after 2-3 seconds of green!

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: Hi , voltage at PPBUS_G3H is 11.96v , sorry what i meant about the dc in board was it seamed to work worked in another board

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: Is that with just the board and MagSafe plugged in? Because if so that’s way too low. SMC suspect

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: 11.96V is with battery connected....must measure without! And I ask again, does the light turn orange?

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: Hi, no the battery is not connected , the board is out of the laptop and i dont get any light at all. If 11.96V is low what should the voltage there

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: If you don’t get a light...using known good MagSafe board? PP3v42 present? PPBUS should be 12.56 volts which makes the SMC suspect.

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: Hi thanks , yes dc in board ive tried 3 new ones , will try changing the smc, does the smc have to be from an 820-3332 or could i use one from a similar board ?

title: 820-3332 no green light
message:
The SMC may not be the problem answer the questions in this order.....

1. Is PP3v42 present?
2. If it is, what is the resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the ISL6259
3. What is your voltage on SMC_RESET_L?
4. Does the SMC area look like it has had liquid damage (obvious corrosion, red probe points)?

title: 820-3332 no green light
message:
Hi
pp3v42 = 3.4v
resistance between 17/18 is 4.1 and 27/28 is 20.6
voltage on smc_rest_l = 3.34v
board looks completely clean all over

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: 11.9V should be 12.56 or 12.3 at least. Is ACOK present? Did you check PPBUS on the fuse?

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: Hi yes ACOK is 3.2V at pin 14 u7000, dc in fuse is 20v , ppbus_g3h at fuse f7040 / f7041 has now changed to 5.3v which was 11.96v

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: Hi , yes ACOK is 3.2v at pin 14 u7000, dc in fuse f6905 is 20v and ppbus at f7040 / f7041 which was 11.9v has now dropped to 5.3v ?

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: ISL6259 could be bad. Also check the resistance between 17/18 and 27/28 again and also check voltage at DCIN pin.

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: looks like isl6259 went bad , now have green light , but now have 12.26V at ppbus f7040 / f7041, dc in fuse is still 20v, is 12.56v at ppbus now pointing to smc ??

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: 12.26v at PPBUS_G3H is too low. When the SMC communicates with the ISL6259 PPBUS_G3H will be 12.56v. Is SMC_RESET_L 3.4v?

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: Green light should also turn orange after 2 seconds, does it do that?

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: ok , i lost green light all together and developed a short on pp3v42 so i injected 3.4v into the line and the smc started to get hot, changed the smc and now i have green light back that now turns to orange after a few seconds and the fans spin up for a second then turn off and spin up again , SMC_RESET_L is 3.2v if thats still any relevance

title: 820-3332 no green light
message:
Could be anything. You also need to wonder how the SMC died. Probably voltage spike on 3v42 from you shorting something out. Damage could be extensive now on the 3V42 rail too.

Is CPU Vcore coming on? PPBUS stable at 12.6V?

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: CPU_VCORE isnt coming on , PPBUS is steady at 12.48V

title: 820-3332 no green light
message: 12.48 is not a normal voltage. It should either be 12.56 or 12.3. But not that important right now as it should turn on with 12.48. CPU Vcore not coming up can be absolutely anything. I suspect 3V42 went high and everything on that rail could be bad. Clock chip is the first suspect that could also affect CPU Vcore.
